paper_title.ja: Mössbauer Spectroscopic Studies of Perovskite-Type Oxides Ln<sub>1-x</sub>A<sub>x</sub>BO<sub>3</sub> (Ln = La, Eu ; A = Ca, Sr, Ba ; B = Fe, Mn) Synthesized by Sol-gel Method
paper_title.en: Mössbauer spectroscopic studies of perovskite-type oxides Ln1-xAxBO3 synthesized by the sol-gel method

description.en:
Synthesis of perovskite-type oxides Ln1-xAxBO3 (Ln: lanthanoid
 A: alkaline earth
 B: transition metal) by heating at low temperature with large ratio of alkaline earth element, especially barium, easily involves impurity of alkaline earth carbonate. We succeeded to prepare the precursor without the formation of barium carbonate even at a large content of barium. The chemical state and structure of Ln1-xAxBO3-δ (Ln: La, Eu: A: Ca, Sr, Ba: B: Fe, Mn) perovskite-type oxides prepared by using those precursors have been studied by Mössbauer spectroscopy and X-ray powder diffraction. The X-ray powder patterns showed many types of crystal system depending on x.

publication_name.en: Journal of Radioanalytical and Nuclear Chemistry

paper_title.en: Design of novel inorganic-organic hybrid materials based on iron-chloranilate mononuclear complexes: Characteristics of hydrogen-bond-supported layers toward the intercalation of guests

description.en: Novel intercalation compounds constructed from the common two-dimensional hydrogen-bond-supported layers and functional guests {(H(0.5)phz)(2)[Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)].2H(2)O}(n) (1), {[Fe(Cp)(2)][Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)]}(n) (2), {[Fe(Cp*)(2)][Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)]}(n) (3), and {(TTF)(2)[Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)]}(n) (4) (H(2)CA = chloranilic acid, phz = phenazine, [Fe(CP)(2)] = ferrocene, [Fe(Cp*)(2)] = decamethylferrocene, TTF = tetrathiafulvalene) are described. The guest cations are introduced between the [Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)](m-)} layers by electrostatic (1-4) and pi-pi stacking (3, 4) interactions. [Fe(Cp*)(2)](+) cations in 3 are stacked on each other making tilted columns which are included in the channel created by the chlorine atoms of CA(2-) dianions. TTF cations in 4 are stacked face to face with two types of S...S distances (type A; 3.579(3) Angstrom, and type B; 3.618(3) Angstrom) making a columnar structure. The TTF cations in the stacked column have a head-to-tail arrangement with respect to the iron-chloranilate layer. Mossbauer spectroscopy suggests that [Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)](m-) anion in 3 is consistent with high-spin (S = 5/2) iron(III) ions and [Fe(CP*)(2)](+) in the low-spin (S = 1/2) iron(III) ions. In 4, Mossbauer spectroscopy shows high-spin iron(II) ions (IS 1.10 mm.s(-1) and QS = 1.66 mm.s(-1) at 297 K) and high-spin iron(III) ions (IS = 0.42 mm.s(-1) and QS = 1.27 mm.s(-1) at 297 K), suggesting that the anionic layer of iron-chloranilate has a valence-trapped mixed-valence state. At the temperature range of 77-300 K, the compounds 1, 2, and 3 are EPR silent, whereas the EPR spectrum of 4 shows two types of signals with g = 2.008 indicating the radical form of TTF.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY

Design of novel inorganic-organic hybrid materials based on iron-chloranilate mononuclear complexes: Characteristics of hydrogen-bond-supported layers toward the intercalation of guests

description.en: Novel intercalation compounds constructed from the common two-dimensional hydrogen-bond-supported layers and functional guests {(H(0.5)phz)(2)[Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)].2H(2)O}(n) (1), {[Fe(Cp)(2)][Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)]}(n) (2), {[Fe(Cp*)(2)][Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)]}(n) (3), and {(TTF)(2)[Fe(CA)(2)(H2O)(2)]}(n) (4) (H(2)CA = chloranilic acid, phz = phenazine, [Fe(CP)(2)] = ferrocene, [Fe(Cp*)(2)] = decamethylferrocene, TTF = tetrathiafulvalene) are described. The role of silicon atoms inside the Brownmillerite phase of cement clinker

description.en: Seven samples of the ferrite phase of cement clinker (Brownmillerite) were prepared at 1350 degreesC. The first sample is a pure Brownmillerite, while the other six samples are doped with 3, 6, 9, 12, 15 and 30 mol% SiO2. Structural role and solubility limit of SiO2 in the Brownmillerite phase were investigated by Mossbauer effect, X-ray diffraction (XRD) and scanning electron microscope (SEM). Above the solubility limit of SiO2, dicalcium silicate phase of cement clinker was observed in the XRD pattern, as a result of the interaction of SiO2 with CaO. Mossbauer spectrum measured at room temperature shows that the pure Brownmillerite has three iron sites; two of them are magnetic and the third is superparamagnetic because of its small particle size. The superparamagnetic doublet disappears and replaced by a sextet when measured at liquid N-2 temperature.
